headline: Air Lease Is Going Private. Why Boeing Stock Is Up.
summary: A big aircraft lessor is going private, a modest signal of confidence in the outlook for the aviation industry.  Tuesday,  Air Lease  said it had agreed to be acquired by investors including Sumitomo, SMBC Aviation Capital, investment vehicles affiliated with  Apollo  and  Brookfield  Shareholders are getting $65 per share in cash.  Air Lease stock was up 6.6% in midday trading, at $64.17, while the  and  were down 1.4% and 1.1%, respectively.

Air Lease stock was up 6.6% in midday trading, at $64.17, while the  and  were down 1.4% and 1.1%, respectively.

summary: BAE Systems secures a major $1.74 billion APKWS contract, extending its role in delivering combat-proven precision rocket systems.

headline: Boeing (BA) Expands 737 MAX Orders with Macquarie AirFinance Commitment
summary: Boeing (BA) recently announced a partnership with Macquarie AirFinance for 30 additional 737-8 jets, highlighting its expanding commitment to airline fleet modernization and sustainability. Over the last quarter, Boeing’s stock rose 11%, which contrasts against the broader market's volatility, further influenced by mixed economic signals and a steep decline in the tech sector. Boeing’s new orders from major airlines like Korean Air and Cathay Pacific, alongside the positive earnings outcomes...

headline: Ryanair Issues Impressive Traffic Numbers for August 2025
summary: RYAAY reports an August 2025 load factor of 96%, which remained flat on a year-over-year basis and sequentially.

headline: Optimum Energy Appoints Erik Norwood as Chief Product Officer, Driving Performance and Innovation in Energy Infrastructure
summary: SEATTLE & BATON ROUGE, La., September 02, 2025--Optimum Energy, a global leader in holistic energy and optimization infrastructure, today announced the appointment of Erik Norwood as its new Chief Product Officer. This key hire reinforces the company's commitment to delivering comprehensive energy solutions that provide continued savings, reliability, and resilience to its clients across higher education, healthcare, and advanced manufacturing.

headline: Boeing Lands Fresh 30 Jet Order As Macquarie AirFinance Expands Fleet Ambitions
summary: On Tuesday, Boeing Company (NYSE:BA) announced winning an order for 30 737-8 jets from Macquarie AirFinance. The 737-8, recognized for its versatility, seats up to 210 passengers based on configuration and offers a range of 3,500 nautical miles (6,480 km). With this order, Macquarie AirFinance will expand its 737 MAX portfolio to 70, providing its airline customers with access to the latest generation aircraft. Also Read: Boeing’s ‘Strong’ Offer Rejected As 3,200 Machinists Push For Bigger Gains

headline: Australia's Macquarie AirFinance to add 30 Boeing 737-8s to its fleet
summary: Macquarie AirFinance did not disclose financial details of the deal, which marks its second direct order with Boeing.  Both Macquarie AirFinance and Boeing did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comments on the financial details of the deal.  Boeing said separately that the purchase was booked in July as "unidentified" on its orders and deliveries website and brings Macquarie AirFinance's 737 MAX order book to 70, with the aircraft scheduled for delivery through to 2032.

headline: Boeing, Macquarie AirFinance Announce Order for 30 737 MAX Airplanes
summary: Boeing [NYSE: BA] and Macquarie AirFinance announced today the lessor has increased its commitment to the 737 MAX with an order for 30 737-8 jets. The purchase was booked in July as unidentified on Boeing's Orders & Deliveries website.
